description:
This dashboard provides a comprehensive overview of the health and performance of a Imua blockchain node. It monitors sync status, consensus metrics, block processing times, transaction activity, validator participation, and system resource usage. The dashboard helps identify network issues, node performance bottlenecks, and memory management efficiency, offering critical insights for maintaining an optimized and healthy node.
For detailed documentation of the metrics, visit:
https://github.com/Cumulo-pro/ExocoreTools/blob/main/monitoring/exocore_metrics.md#block-interval-time-sum

options.content:
Imua Node metrics

by Cumulo

Imua Node Metrics Documentation

panels.description: Indicates whether the node is currently syncing blocks. Displays 1 if syncing, 0 if not. Helps diagnose the synchronization status, allowing operators to confirm if the node is up-to-date
panels.title: Sync Status

panels.description: Displays the current height of the chain. Useful for confirming node progress and ensuring it is in sync with the network.
panels.title: Chain Height

panels.description: Represents the total number of validators in the network. Useful for monitoring the size of the validator set.
panels.title: Number of Validators

panels.description: Indicates if the node is currently state syncing. Displays 1 if syncing, 0 if not. Helps diagnose the state sync status, allowing operators to confirm if the node is up-to-date
panels.title: State Syncing Status

panels.description: Displays the number of peers connected to the node. Important for understanding the nodeâs connectivity and resilience in the network.
panels.title: Number of Peers

panels.description: Indicates the number of blocks missed by the validator.Helps monitor validator reliability and can signal issues with validator performance.
panels.title: Missed Blocks (Validator)

panels.description: Shows the voting power of a specific validator. Provides insights into the influence of a validator within the network, based on its assigned voting power.
panels.title: Validator Power

panels.description: Measures the size of the most recent block in bytes. Provides insights into block capacity usage, which can be useful for understanding the volume of data processed per block.
panels.title: Block Size

panels.description: Displays the last block height signed by the validator.Useful for tracking validator activity and confirming timely participation.
panels.title: Last Signed Height (Validator)

panels.description: This metric shows the voting power (stake) that absent validators represent. A high power of absent validators can have a negative impact on the security and decentralization of the network, as it reduces the available consensus power. Value: total power of the validators who are absent in the consensus process.
panels.title: NÂº Missing Validators

panels.description: Displays the number of transactions included in the current block. Offers insight into network activity and transaction throughput.
panels.title: Number of Transactions

panels.description: Shows the total number of transactions processed by the node.Offers an overview of the transaction throughput, indicating network activity levels.
panels.title: Total Transactions

panels.description: This histogram metric measures the time taken between the BeginBlock and EndBlock events in milliseconds, with various time intervals. Helps monitor the block processing duration, which is essential for understanding the efficiency of block execution and identifying potential bottlenecks.
panels.title: State Block  Processing Time

panels.description: This metric provides the average time it takes for the node to process a block, calculated by dividing the total block processing time (cometbft_state_block_processing_time_sum) by the total number of blocks processed (cometbft_state_block_processing_time_count). Monitoring the average block processing time is crucial for evaluating the efficiency of block finalization. If the average time increases, it may indicate potential performance bottlenecks or issues with the node's processing power. Keeping the average block processing time within an optimal range helps ensure the smooth functioning of the network and avoids delays in transaction finalization.
panels.title: Average Block Processing Time

panels.description: Shows the count of votes received by the node that correspond to earlier heights and rounds than the current state, categorized by vote type (prevote or precommit). Allows monitoring of late votes, which can help diagnose potential network latency or communication issues.
panels.title: Late Votes

panels.description: Shows the count of proposals received by the node since its start, categorized by status (accepted or rejected). Useful for tracking proposal processing rates and success rates of proposals.
panels.title: Proposal Receive Count

panels.description: Represents the number of validators that failed to sign the latest block. Aids in identifying validator participation and availability issues.
panels.title: NÂº Missing Validators

panels.description: Shows the total power of validators that did not sign the latest block. Highlights the influence of missing validators on network consensus based on their voting power.
panels.title: Missing Validators Power

panels.description: Counts the total number of times consensus parameters have been updated since the process started. Useful for tracking changes in consensus configuration, which may affect network operation and performance.
panels.title: Consensus Parameter Updates

panels.description: Displays the total power of validators involved in byzantine behavior. Highlights the impact of byzantine validators based on their total voting power.
panels.title: Byzantine Validators Power

panels.description: Shows the count of validators that attempted to double-sign or engage in other byzantine behavior.Aids in identifying malicious validators in the network.

targets.legendFormat: NÂº validators that attempted to double-sign

panels.title: Byzantine Validators

panels.description: Indicates the cumulative voting power of all validators. Helps gauge the overall security and decentralization of the network.
panels.title: Total Validators Power

panels.description: Measures the time interval between the proposal timestamp and the timestamp of the latest prevote in a round where all validators have voted, segmented by proposer_address. Helps track and optimize the consensus round timing.
panels.title: Full Prevote Delay

panels.description: This metric calculates the average block interval time on the cometbft blockchain, enabling monitoring of block production consistency and detecting potential delays. The average is derived by dividing the total interval time (cometbft_consensus_block_interval_seconds_sum) by the block count (cometbft_consensus_block_interval_seconds_count) over a specified time range. This provides insight into the block production speed over time.
panels.title: Block Interval Average

panels.description:
Indicates the total number of recorded block intervals. Useful for verifying the regularity of block production and ensuring the node consistently registers blocks.
Essential for calculating the average block interval and checking production frequency.
panels.title: Block Interval Time Count

panels.description: Represents the cumulative time elapsed between blocks since monitoring started. Useful for calculating the average time between blocks when combined with count.
panels.title: Block Interval Time Sum

panels.description: Shows the number of block parts sent by each peer in the network, identified by peer_id. Allows monitoring the distribution of block parts, which can help identify network traffic patterns or potential issues in data sharing between peers.
panels.title: Block Parts Transmitted by Peer

panels.description: Shows the number of uncommitted transactions in the mempool. Useful for understanding transaction backlog and network congestion.
panels.title: Mempool Size

panels.description: Counts the number of bytes received for each P2P message type (e.g., blocksync_BlockResponse, consensus_BlockPart). Enables analysis of network traffic and data flow efficiency, helping to optimize P2P performance.
panels.title: P2P Message Received Bytes

panels.description: Indicates the total size of transactions in the mempool, in bytes. Helps assess memory usage and transaction volume awaiting processing.
panels.title: Mempool Size in Bytes

panels.description: Shows the number of connections actively used for gossiping transactions in the mempool. Helps monitor network connectivity and transaction dissemination efficiency.
panels.title: Active Outbound Connections in Mempool

panels.description: Shows the number of bytes sent for each P2P message type. Helps in assessing outbound traffic and understanding message distribution patterns.
panels.title: P2P Message Sent Bytes

panels.description: Counts the number of times transactions are rechecked in the mempool. Provides insights into transaction re-evaluation processes, useful for analyzing mempool behavior.
panels.title: Mempool Recheck Count

panels.description: This summary metric captures the duration of garbage collection cycles in seconds, with various quantiles. Helps assess the impact of garbage collection on performance, allowing for memory management optimization.
panels.title: Go Garbage Collection Duration

panels.description: Shows the current number of goroutines.Useful for monitoring concurrency in Go applications, as excessive goroutines may indicate resource contention or potential memory leaks.
panels.title: Number of Goroutines

panels.description: Total CPU time consumed by the process
panels.title: Process CPU Seconds Total

panels.description: Resident memory size in bytes.
panels.title: Process Resident Memory Bytes

title: Imua Dashboard by Cumulo Copy
